data.title: Hooters abruptly closes dozens of 'underperforming' restaurants. Are Oklahoma's affected?
data.meta_description: A chain restaurant well known for its wings and waitresses has closed over 40 stores nationwide. Here's what we know.
data.text:
Reports are popping up all over the country of Hooters restaurants shuttering their doors unexpectedly.

According to an initial report from Nation's Restaurant News, the chain known for its chicken wings and orange and white waitress uniforms abruptly closed dozens of locations, due to "current market conditions."

One Hooters location in Oklahoma has closed at 13320 N Pennsylvania Ave. in OKC, and nearly 40 other locations have shuttered across the nation, from Louisville to Bryan, Texas, and Lakeland, Fla.

Red Lobster closings 2024: Any Oklahoma Red Lobster restaurants closing? Here's the national list

Why are Hooters locations closing?

In an emailed statement to The Sun, Hooters attributed the closing to the "current market conditions."

"Ensuring the well-being of our staff is our priority in these rare instances," the email read. "With new Hooters restaurants opening domestically and internationally, new Hooters frozen products launching at grocery stores, and the Hooters footprint expanding into new markets with both company and franchise locations, this brand of 41 years remains highly resilient and relevant. We look forward to continuing to serve our guests at home, on the go and at our restaurants here in the U.S. and around the globe."
